SEARCH
Package org.attribyte.snook.auth

Class Users

java.lang.Object
org.attribyte.snook.auth.Users
public class Users extends Object
A credentials file is of the following format. 

    #Comments like this and blank lines are ignored.

    #Generates a password and hash.
    username0:$password$

    #Generates a token and hash.
    username0:$token$

    #Generates a 'Basic' auth token and hash of base64([username]:[token]).
    username0:$basic$

    #Generates a password hash.
    username1:$password$topsecret

    #Generates a hashed token.
    username1:$token$12345123451234512345

    #Generates a hashed token for 'Basic' auth.
    username1:$basic$123451234512345

    #A previously generated hashed token.
    username2:$sha256$f67ca736829c9c3d3f580877b728ff122e903ca7c19bf43c598fe5b082a4ac91

    #A previously generated hashed password.
    username2:$2a$04$F4UtBMn30o6kRRsl7TwyKuPdUFXIQVVJCUndiXa3YhkiD1uNOCUBG

  • Method Details

    • generateFiles

      public static void generateFiles(File inputFile, File secureFile, File insecureFile, boolean overwrite) throws IOException
      Generate a secure and insecure file from an input file.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - The input file.
      secureFile - The secure file - contains only hashes.
      insecureFile - The insecure file - may contain comments, tokens and cleartext passwords.
      overwrite - If true, existing files will be overwritten.
      Throws:
      IOException - on read error or invalid file.

    • generateFiles

      public static void generateFiles(InputStream is, File secureFile, File insecureFile, boolean overwrite) throws IOException
